ygData.subject: Warrior Joins The Battle.
ygData.msgSnippet: ( Carnage: Since there is a widespread battle, I shall post quickly and shortly, so that things may move along smoothly.) ** Dinobot could hear weapons fire

( Carnage: Since there is a widespread battle, I shall post quickly and 
shortly, so that things may move along smoothly.)

** Dinobot could hear weapons fire from where Tavatron and himself strode, 
wondering just whom it was who was attacking the bast this time?
Predacons? Alliance? But that was only a slight thought, where the main 
concern for him was whether he could get to the battle on time to get in a 
bit of the action.
Though, his thoughts were partly urging him to go on ahead towards the 
battle another, more deeper set part of his mind, made him remain by 
Tavtron�s side as she let out the first line which was to lead to the whole 
telling of her reason for abandonment. Where he belonged for now.
And he had to admit; Tavatron�s first sentence was an attention grabber.
Dinobot glanced towards the steady pacing fembot, wondering just what 
horrors must play in her mind from recalling her past. And it must be fairly 
painful�that he could extract from the single vocal line which had flowed 
from her throat.
Though, a horrific tale to once could seem as nothing more then everyday 
speech to another.
And Dinobot had almost heard it all.
Mutilation, rape, decapitation, torture, abandonment, molestation�you name 
it, he had most likely heard of it or seen it. But, there were always times 
something new came along, and this could be one of those times. However, 
Dinobot�s mind wasn�t set in just what category he could place Tavatron�s 
explanation under, it was dwelling on what effect this telling would have on 
Tavtron herself. She was his main concern.
But if anything, he was a listener.
His main scanners brought up what he knew of Beta Prime when Tavtron 
mentioned it, and it wasn�t much. Though, what she gave him as a description 
of the atmosphere there fit.
Desert, heavily mined and protected by soldiers Tavatron mentioned, and the 
occasional family unit.
And at Tavtron�s next words, mainly sought after.
Terrorist raids.
Dinobot looked towards Tavatron then, hearing her sigh and seeing in depth 
in which her optics looked upon things, noticing that it was the depth of 
one looking at memories with which they just remembered.
And her shudder, which brought the thought that, whatever she was 
remembering of the details she couldn�t express with words, was deeply 
imbedded and onset of what she must have lived through.
But he listened what Tavatron said and took it in, turning it over in his 
head and going over what she managed to tell him.
It slightly bothered him to hear that Tavatron had been at the tender age of 
5 when this had all happened, when this nightmare in her life took place.
However, all of this had turned out to be nothing new to him.
Every transformer on this miserable planet had a story, including him. 
Tavatron�s was simple to explain.
Home raided. Population terminated. Parents died and basically left alone to 
fend for her. Living with the scars for the remainder of her life.
At least a bot whom was stabbed with a sword could heal and go on with their 
life; mental wounds left from an encounter with fate and effected the 
mind�had a less likely chance to heal.
Dinobot sighed. Memories sometimes effected the way a bot live their life. 
He was proof.
His mother never wants him, though his father had been proud. Father died at 
7. Mother ignored him completely. Then she remarried and had another child 
whom she spoiled rotten. Still ignored him. Didn�t tell his half-brother 
that they were related until he was 16. Left home and joined the Predacon 
Forces at 17. Never returned except once, where he returned with his wages 
and gave them to his mother to use in hard times.
Then, disappeared from their lives completely.
But Dinobot�s life had not been as traumatic as Tavatron�s, he had not seen 
the horrors of the dead until he was well into his career as a soldier.
Though, he could still relate to her.
They had both lost their parents at a young age�he had lost his father�and 
that was the only parent he had ever known to deserve the name of one. His 
mother had been nothing but a woman he knew�and sometimes let him inside 
when it was cold�like some unwanted dog.
But both of their childhood�s were gone too early�they had known to hate 
when they should have been playing with their friends and learning all the 
good things in life.
Fate seemed to deal to horrid blows on the young far too often these days.
Though, Dinobot had not always been cold and hard like he had grown to be. 
With too much battle and seeing too much death. Yet, he had grown to hunger 
for it.
But�before all of that, he had simply been a small boy, growing alongside 
his father.
Though, after his death Dinobot�s sense of humor had disappeared, and since 
his mother had mistreated him but never let him leave until he finally 
forced her too�he basically forgot how to smile�or ever care.
Only now, with Tavatron, had he remembered how to care again.
Dinobot glanced at Tavatron again, seeing her kick up a bit of sand and hum 
a rather nice tune.
If only she knew just how much they had in common.
Love for battle. Uncann7y liking to be alone and out in the open. And 
unforgivable pasts. Only, HIS past he could easily speak about, all anyone 
need do was ask.
But then Dinobot listened to Tavatron�s explanation of her past friend and 
what grim fate he came to.
So THAT was the reason she had run out on him! That was the reason Tavatron 
had left him�because she didn�t want to see if he died as well�the same way 
her friend did.
Dinobot growled deeply while looking towards the Cybertronian Fire and the 
battle, knowing now the answer with which he had come seeking.
But now that everything had been answered, the battle was now what was on 
his mind.
It was only now that he saw the Alliance gestalts, watching them fore 
towards the ship�s shields in order to try and knock them offline�to get at 
the base on the inside.
Dinobot snarled and transformed into Robot mode, not even noticing Tavatron 
converting into beast mode and heading towards the battle.
From where he stood, he was choosing his target�his scanners zooming in on 
almost every bot until they suddenly spotted one which seemed perfect.
Sixshot.
His tail swinging slightly he looked around the battle firled to see if 
there were any places where he could get the Alliance bot by surprise.
There were no places.
Dinobot growled, then began to move off towards the battle, his optics on 
Sixshot all the time while he moved onto the field.
There were bots all around.
Dinobot bared his teeth and aimed towards the bot's chest-plate, locking on 
target and firing.**
